column1: #Text=Wikinews interviews Mr. Orange of IWL in Taiwan about wrestling
#Text=, a sport derived from Greco-Roman freestyle wrestling , is often connected with the idea of sports-entertainment .
#Text=Popularized by Japanese and American federations ( e. g.
#Text=, New Japan Pro Wrestling , etc. ) the ongoing events and news are often discussed on the Internet .
#Text=As such , television programs and other mass media focused on pro-wrestling are commonplace in Japan , America , and Europe .
#Text=In Taiwan , fans do not simply watch the TV shows and discuss them via the Internet , but some of them participate in the sport of wrestling through communities from the Internet or colleges .

#Text=Although a Taiwanese wrestler recently won a world-class pro-wrestling title , due to policies that focused only on promoting key athletic sports like baseball , billiards , basketball , and taekwondo ( i. e. those with more possibilities to win a gold medal in the Asian Games or Olympics ) , governmental officials lost a great opportunity to promote sports like wrestling , which has many potential participants .
#Text=What 's the vision of wrestling in Taiwan ?
#Text=How did the communities drive TV spectators and wrestling fans and government officials pay more attention in wrestling ?
#Text=Is wrestling a future key sport in Taiwan ?

#Text=In my side is  Mr. Orange " , WWE TV show commentator of VideoLand Max TV in Taiwan , I will do a special interview for topics related to wrestling , and he will do an overview of wrestling in Taiwan with his experiences .

column1: #Text=Glad to see an unofficial wrestling match in the Taipei City Mall .
#Text=How did you involve in wrestling initially ?
#Text=: Since I 'm in a childhood , I often watch ( wrestling ) shows with my neighborhood to a period when going to kindergarten .
#Text=And then , I progressively understood the meaning of wrestling and finally involved in it .
#Text=In what region of a wrestling match did you watch at first ?
#Text=Matches in there are often packaged and refined excellently such as theme music , introduction , momentum of wrestlers better then matches in Japan , which just contained traditional rules .
#Text=On the other way of wrestling in Taiwan , what are the opportunities , possibilities , and threats ?
#Text=: It was considered as a bad sport and not well-known in public opinion in Taiwan .

#Text=As of some unofficial communities like us , we held periodical friendship matches to help the public correct their biased and wrong view of wrestling , especially the quote : " Wrestling played reality not just a fight , scuffle , or violent sport .
